docs.snippet: After 27 years of civil war, Angola's best chance for peace may be at hand. Leaderless since Jonas Savimbi was killed in February by government soldiers, the rebel National Union for the Total Independence of Angola, or Unita, agreed to a cease-fi...
docs.lead_paragraph: After 27 years of civil war, Angola's best chance for peace may be at hand. Leaderless since Jonas Savimbi was killed in February by government soldiers, the rebel National Union for the Total Independence of Angola, or Unita, agreed to a cease-fire, which the battered Angolan people hope will bring an end to one of Africa's most enduring conflicts. Since the war began in 1975, it has taken hundreds of thousands of lives and set Angola's development back decades. Henri E. Cauvin

docs.snippet: POOR-Anne K. 84, of South Mountain Road, New City, NY, Died peacefully January 12, Nyack, NY, Hospital. Distinguished artist. Member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters, National Academy of Design. Longtime teacher and Trustee of Skowhegan...
docs.lead_paragraph: POOR-Anne K. 84, of South Mountain Road, New City, NY, Died peacefully January 12, Nyack, NY, Hospital. Distinguished artist. Member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters, National Academy of Design. Longtime teacher and Trustee of Skowhegan School of Painting and Sculpture. WAC Air Force war artist in World War II. Represented in major museums. Survived by brother Peter of New York City, nieces Candida Monteith and Anna Poor, and nephew Graham Poor.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  POOR, ANNE K.

docs.snippet: Passenger traffic at Japan's main gateway, Narita Airport, fell to a 10-year low after the terrorist attacks in the United States and the war in Central Asia. Arrivals and departures at the airport, which handles just over half of Japan's internat...
docs.lead_paragraph: Passenger traffic at Japan's main gateway, Narita Airport, fell to a 10-year low after the terrorist attacks in the United States and the war in Central Asia. Arrivals and departures at the airport, which handles just over half of Japan's international traffic, fell to 1.5 million in November, 32 percent less than the same month a year earlier. It was the first time since April 1991, just after the war in the Persian Gulf, that traffic slipped below 1.6 million passengers. Ken Belson (NYT)
docs.abstract: Passenger traffic at Japan's main gateway, Narita Airport, fell to 10-year low of 1.5 million in Nov, down 32 percent from Nov 2000, in wake of terrorist attacks in United States (S)

headline.main: World Business Briefing | Asia: Japan: Airline Traffic Off

docs.snippet: Six countries involved in the war in Congo are to meet today to evaluate efforts over the last two and a half years to end one of Africa's most complex wars. The one-day meeting of heads of state, to be held in Lusaka, Zambia, takes place as deleg...
docs.lead_paragraph: Six countries involved in the war in Congo are to meet today to evaluate efforts over the last two and a half years to end one of Africa's most complex wars. The one-day meeting of heads of state, to be held in Lusaka, Zambia, takes place as delegates to reconciliation talks try to come up with a plan to end the conflict before an April 12 deadline. Rwanda and Uganda have supported the rebels in the war while Zimbabwe, Angola and Namibia have backed the government.
docs.abstract: Six countries involved in Congo war to meet on efforts to end complex conflict (S)

headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: Congo: Leaders To Assess Peace Efforts

docs.snippet: A review on Jan. 6 about ''Anthony Blunt: His Lives,'' by Miranda Carter, misstated the position of Michael Straight, an American who knew the British art historian and Soviet spy Anthony Blunt at Cambridge University before World War II. From 196...
docs.lead_paragraph: A review on Jan. 6 about ''Anthony Blunt: His Lives,'' by Miranda Carter, misstated the position of Michael Straight, an American who knew the British art historian and Soviet spy Anthony Blunt at Cambridge University before World War II. From 1969 to 1977 Straight was deputy chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts; he was never its chairman. The review also referred incorrectly to the sides in the Spanish Civil War; the rebels represented the political right, not the left, and received help from fascist nations, not from the Soviet Union.
docs.abstract: Correction of January 6 review of Anthony Blunt: His Lives by Miranda Carter (S)
